author: Dena Aubin
title: Navy reservist gets trial over Morgan Stanley arbitration bid
text:
A federal judge in Chicago has ordered a trial on whether a Navy reservist must arbitrate his claims that Morgan Stanley Smith Barney unlawfully terminated him from his job as a financial advisor after he was called to active duty last year.
In an opinion on Wednesday, U.S. District Judge Matthew Kennelly said he could not resolve Morgan Stanleyâ€™s bid to force the dispute into arbitration because a genuine dispute exists over whether the reservist, Rajesh Gupta, received the arbitration agreement the firm is trying to enforce.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2I5Evg0
